required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of rhTSH in the Treatment of Patients With Thyroid Cancer After Resection of Stage I/II
clinical_study.official_title: I/II Clinical Study of Dose-tolerance, Pharmacokinetics, and Iodine Uptake in Recombinant Human Thyroid Stimulating Hormone in Patients After Thyroidectomy

brief_summary.textblock: Dose-increasing tolerance, pharmacokinetics, and iodine uptake effects of recombinant human thyroid stimulating hormone in patients after thyroidectomy

detailed_description.textblock: This phase 1 and 2 study of rhTSH, To observe the safety and tolerability characteristics of different doses of rhTSH in patients after thyroidectomy, and to observe the dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) and maximum tolerated dose (MTD) that may occur in the set dose group.The study is a Non-randomized, open, one-arm study.

secondary_outcome.description: area under curve of serum thyrotropin concentration
whole body radioiodine imaging after rhTSH administration and after thyroid hormone withdrawal
classification and degree of adverse events

intervention.intervention_name: Recombinant Human Thyroid Stimulating Hormone for Injection
intervention.description: Each was dissolved in 1.2 mL of sterile water for injection to obtain a solution containing 0.9 mg/mL rhTSH, which was intramuscularly injected according to the dosing schedule.
